Package interfaces

Interface iClient

  • public interface iClient
    Interface defining the actions for client interaction. This interface provides methods for simulating various user interactions like tapping, long pressing, sending keystrokes, and more.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean disableAFKHandler()
      Disables the internal AFK handler.
      boolean disableBreakHandler()
      Disables the internal Break handler.
      boolean disableSleepHandler()
      Disables the internal Sleep handler.

      Performs a drag/swipe action with a start/end area and a duration.

      Performs a drag/swipe action with a start/end area and a duration.

      Performs a drag/swipe action with a start/end area and a duration.

      Enables the internal AFK handler again if you disabled it.

      Enables the internal Break handler again if you disabled it.

      Searches for a specific string in the menu to tap on.

      Searches for a specific string in the menu to tap on.
      java.util.List<java.awt.Rectangle> getObjectsFromColor​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors, int tolerance)
      Retrieves a list of rectangles containing objects of specified colors with the given tolerance level.
      java.util.List<java.awt.Rectangle> getObjectsFromColor​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors, int tolerance, java.util.List<java.awt.Color> exclusionColors, int exclusionTolerance)
      Retrieves a list of rectangles containing objects of specified colors with the given tolerance level, excluding objects of specified exclusion colors with the given exclusion tolerance.
      java.util.List<java.awt.Rectangle> getObjectsFromColorsInRect​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors, java.awt.Rectangle searchRect, int tolerance)
      Retrieves a list of rectangles containing objects of specified colors within the given search rectangle.
      java.util.List<java.awt.Rectangle> getObjectsFromColorsInRect​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors, java.awt.Rectangle searchRect, int tolerance, java.util.List<java.awt.Color> exclusionColors, int exclusionTolerance)
      Retrieves a list of rectangles containing objects of specified colors within the given search rectangle, excluding objects of specified exclusion colors.
      java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPointsFromColors​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors, int tolerance)
      Retrieves points on the current emulator screen where specified colors are found, considering a specified tolerance for color matching.
      java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPointsFromColors​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors, int tolerance, java.util.List<java.awt.Color> exclusionColors, int exclusionTolerance)
      Retrieves points on the current emulator screen where specified colors are found, excluding specified colors within a certain tolerance, and considering a specified tolerance for the target colors.
      java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPointsFromColorsInRect​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors, java.awt.Rectangle searchRect, int tolerance)
      Searches for specified colors within a defined rectangular area of the game screen, taking into account a specified color tolerance for matching.
      java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPointsFromColorsInRect​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors, java.awt.Rectangle searchRect, int tolerance, java.util.List<java.awt.Color> exclusionColors, int exclusionTolerance)
      Searches for specified colors within a defined rectangular area of the game screen, excluding specified colors within a certain tolerance, and taking into account a specified color tolerance for the target colors.
      boolean isAnyColorInRect​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> targetColors, java.awt.Rectangle regionToSearch, int tolerance)
      Checks if specified colors is found within a rectangle area on the game screen
      boolean isColorAtPoint​(java.awt.Color targetColor, java.awt.Point pointToSearch, int tolerance)
      Checks if a specified color is found on a specific point on the game screen
      boolean isColorInRect​(java.awt.Color targetColor, java.awt.Rectangle regionToSearch, int tolerance)
      Checks if a specified color is found within a rectangle area on the game screen
      boolean isTimeForBreak()
      Checks if the client is expecting a break to be done

      Simulates a long press action within a specified rectangle area.
      void longPress​(java.util.List<java.awt.Point> points)
      Simulates a long press action at a specified coordinate with a list of points to generate its bounding and weighted taps from.

      Simulates a long press at the specified coordinates and then searches for a specific string in the menu that appears to tap on.

      Simulates a long press at the specified coordinates and then searches for a specific string in the menu that appears to tap on.

    • Method Detail

      • tap

        void tap​(int x,
         int y)
        Simulates a tap action at a specified coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate for the tap action.
        y - the y-coordinate for the tap action.

      • tap

        void tap​(java.awt.Point point)
        Simulates a tap action at a specified coordinate using a java.awt.Point.
        Parameters:
        point - The point that contains the x,y coordinates to tap.

      • tap

        void tap​(java.util.List<java.awt.Point> points)
        Simulates a tap action at a specified coordinate using a java.awt.Point.
        Parameters:
        points - A list of points chosen at random to tap.

      • tap

        void tap​(java.util.List<java.awt.Point> points,
         boolean tapWithinRandom)
        Simulates a tap action at a specified coordinate using a java.awt.Point.
        Parameters:
        points - A list of points chosen at random to tap.
        tapWithinRandom - Using this it will generate a random weighted point from within your list of points to tap

      • tap

        void tap​(java.awt.Color targetColor,
         java.awt.Rectangle boundingArea,
         int tolerance)
        Simulates a tap action on a specific color within a defined area.
        Parameters:
        targetColor - the color to target for the tap.
        boundingArea - The area on the screen you'd like to search in
        tolerance - the color tolerance for matching the target color, 0-100, usually 0-15 is enough.

      • tap

        void tap​(java.awt.Polygon polygon)
        Simulates a tap action inside a specific polygon.
        Parameters:
        polygon - the polygon you wish to do the tap in.

      • tap

        void tap​(java.awt.Rectangle rectangle)
        Simulates a tap action inside a specific polygon.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the rectangle you wish to do the tap in.

      • longPress

        void longPress​(int x,
               int y)
        Simulates a long press action at a specified coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate for the long press action.
        y - the y-coordinate for the long press action.

      • longPress

        void longPress​(java.util.List<java.awt.Point> points)
        Simulates a long press action at a specified coordinate with a list of points to generate its bounding and weighted taps from.
        Parameters:
        points - the points list you want to generate a tap from

      • longPress

        void longPress​(java.awt.Color targetColor,
               java.awt.Rectangle boundingArea,
               int tolerance)
        Simulates a long press action on a specific color within a defined area.
        Parameters:
        targetColor - the color to target for the long press.
        boundingArea - The area on the screen you'd like to search in
        tolerance - the color tolerance for matching the target color.

      • longPress

        void longPress​(java.awt.Rectangle rectangle)
        Simulates a long press action within a specified rectangle area.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the rectangle area where the long press should occur.

      • longPressWithMenuAction

        void longPressWithMenuAction​(int x,
                             int y,
                             int rectHeight,
                             int rectWidth,
                             java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                             java.lang.String stringToFind)
        Simulates a long press at the specified coordinates and then searches for a specific string in the menu that appears to tap on.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate for the long press action.
        y - The y-coordinate for the long press action.
        rectHeight - The height of the region to search for the menu.
        rectWidth - The width of the region to search for the menu.
        colors - The list of colors (of the text) to target in the menu.
        stringToFind - The string to search for in the menu.

      • longPressWithMenuAction

        void longPressWithMenuAction​(int x,
                             int y,
                             int rectHeight,
                             int rectWidth,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​int[][]> letterPatterns,
                             java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                             java.lang.String stringToFind)
        Simulates a long press at the specified coordinates and then searches for a specific string in the menu that appears to tap on. This version allows the use of letter patterns for finding the menu options.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate for the long press action.
        y - The y-coordinate for the long press action.
        rectHeight - The height of the region to search for the menu.
        rectWidth - The width of the region to search for the menu.
        letterPatterns - The map containing letter patterns for the OCR matching of the menu text.
        colors - The list of colors (of the text) to target in the menu.
        stringToFind - The string to search for in the menu.

      • longPressWithMenuAction

        void longPressWithMenuAction​(java.awt.Rectangle clickRect,
                             int rectHeight,
                             int rectWidth,
                             java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                             java.lang.String stringToFind)
        Simulates a long press at the specified coordinates and then searches for a specific string in the menu that appears to tap on.
        Parameters:
        clickRect - The java.awt.Rectangle to randomly tap in
        rectHeight - The height of the region to search for the menu.
        rectWidth - The width of the region to search for the menu.
        colors - The list of colors (of the text) to target in the menu.
        stringToFind - The string to search for in the menu.

      • longPressWithMenuAction

        void longPressWithMenuAction​(java.awt.Rectangle clickRect,
                             int rectHeight,
                             int rectWidth,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​int[][]> letterPatterns,
                             java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                             java.lang.String stringToFind)
        Simulates a long press at the specified coordinates and then searches for a specific string in the menu that appears to tap on. This version allows the use of letter patterns for finding the menu options.
        Parameters:
        clickRect - The java.awt.Rectangle to randomly tap in
        rectHeight - The height of the region to search for the menu.
        rectWidth - The width of the region to search for the menu.
        letterPatterns - The map containing letter patterns for the OCR matching of the menu text.
        colors - The list of colors (of the text) to target in the menu.
        stringToFind - The string to search for in the menu.

      • tapWithMenuAction

        void tapWithMenuAction​(int x,
                       int y,
                       int rectHeight,
                       int rectWidth,
                       java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                       java.lang.String stringToFind)
        Simulates a tap at the specified coordinates and then searches for a specific string in the menu that appears to tap on. THIS SHOULD ONLY BE USED IN COMBINATION WITH SINGLE-TAP MODE!
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate for the long press action.
        y - The y-coordinate for the long press action.
        rectHeight - The height of the region to search for the menu.
        rectWidth - The width of the region to search for the menu.
        colors - The list of colors (of the text) to target in the menu.
        stringToFind - The string to search for in the menu.

      • tapWithMenuAction

        void tapWithMenuAction​(int x,
                       int y,
                       int rectHeight,
                       int rectWidth,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​int[][]> letterPatterns,
                       java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                       java.lang.String stringToFind)
        Simulates a tap at the specified coordinates and then searches for a specific string in the menu that appears to tap on. This version allows the use of letter patterns for finding the menu options. THIS SHOULD ONLY BE USED IN COMBINATION WITH SINGLE-TAP MODE!
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate for the long press action.
        y - The y-coordinate for the long press action.
        rectHeight - The height of the region to search for the menu.
        rectWidth - The width of the region to search for the menu.
        letterPatterns - The map containing letter patterns for the OCR matching of the menu text.
        colors - The list of colors (of the text) to target in the menu.
        stringToFind - The string to search for in the menu.

                       java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,

      • tapWithMenuAction

        void tapWithMenuAction​(java.awt.Rectangle clickRect,
                       int rectHeight,
                       int rectWidth,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​int[][]> letterPatterns,
                       java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                       java.lang.String stringToFind)
        Simulates a tap at the specified coordinates and then searches for a specific string in the menu that appears to tap on. This version allows the use of letter patterns for finding the menu options. THIS SHOULD ONLY BE USED IN COMBINATION WITH SINGLE-TAP MODE!
        Parameters:
        clickRect - The java.awt.Rectangle to randomly tap in
        rectHeight - The height of the region to search for the menu.
        rectWidth - The width of the region to search for the menu.
        letterPatterns - The map containing letter patterns for the OCR matching of the menu text.
        colors - The list of colors (of the text) to target in the menu.
        stringToFind - The string to search for in the menu.

      • findAndTapMenuOption

        void findAndTapMenuOption​(java.awt.Rectangle searchArea,
                          java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​int[][]> letterPatterns,
                          java.lang.String stringToFind)
        Searches for a specific string in the menu to tap on.
        Parameters:
        searchArea - The area to search your menu option in.
        letterPatterns - The map containing letter patterns for the OCR matching of the menu text.
        colors - The list of colors (of the text) to target in the menu.
        stringToFind - The string to search for in the menu.

      • findAndTapMenuOption

        void findAndTapMenuOption​(java.awt.Rectangle searchArea,
                          java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                          java.lang.String stringToFind)
        Searches for a specific string in the menu to tap on. This version allows the use of letter patterns for finding the menu options.
        Parameters:
        searchArea - The area to search your menu option in.
        colors - The list of colors (of the text) to target in the menu.
        stringToFind - The string to search for in the menu.

      • drag

        void drag​(int startX,
          int startY,
          int endX,
          int endY,
          int duration)
        Performs a drag/swipe action with a start/end area and a duration. The X/Y (both start and end) are slightly randomized, as well as the duration.
        Parameters:
        startX - The X coordinate to initiate the swipe/drag action from
        startY - The Y coordinate to initiate the swipe/drag action from
        endX - The X coordinate to end the swipe/drag action from
        endY - The Y coordinate to end the swipe/drag action from
        duration - The duration in ms of how long the swipe/drag action should take

      • drag

        void drag​(java.awt.Rectangle startRect,
          java.awt.Rectangle endRect,
          int duration)
        Performs a drag/swipe action with a start/end area and a duration. The rectangles (both start and end) are used to randomly pick points within it. The duration is also slightly randomized each time.
        Parameters:
        startRect - The java.awt.Rectangle to initiate the swipe/drag action from (random coordinate picked from within your rectangle)
        endRect - The java.awt.Rectangle to end the swipe/drag action from (random coordinate picked from within your rectangle)
        duration - The duration in ms of how long the swipe/drag action should take

      • drag

        void drag​(java.awt.Point startPoint,
          java.awt.Point endPoint,
          int duration)
        Performs a drag/swipe action with a start/end area and a duration. The X/Y (both start and end points) are slightly randomized, as well as the duration.
        Parameters:
        startPoint - The java.awt.Point to initiate the swipe/drag action from
        endPoint - The java.awt.Point to end the swipe/drag action from
        duration - The duration in ms of how long the swipe/drag action should take

      • sendKeystroke

        void sendKeystroke​(java.lang.String keystroke)
        Sends a specific keystroke to the client.
        Parameters:
        keystroke - the string representing the keystroke to be sent.

      • restartApp

        void restartApp()
        Restarts the application associated with this client.

      • moveCameraUp

        void moveCameraUp()
        Simulates the action of moving the camera up.

      • disableBreakHandler

        boolean disableBreakHandler()
        Disables the internal Break handler. Do note that you will have to manage breaks yourself with the login/logout methods and a custom implementation.
        Returns:
        Break handler stopped or not

      • disableSleepHandler

        boolean disableSleepHandler()
        Disables the internal Sleep handler. Do note that you will have to manage sleeps yourself with the login/logout methods and a custom implementation.
        Returns:
        Sleep handler stopped or not

      • enableBreakHandler

        boolean enableBreakHandler()
        Enables the internal Break handler again if you disabled it.
        Returns:
        Break handler enabled or not

      • enableSleepHandler

        boolean enableSleepHandler()
        Enables the internal Sleep handler again if you disabled it.
        Returns:
        Sleep handler enabled or not

      • disableAFKHandler

        boolean disableAFKHandler()
        Disables the internal AFK handler. Do note that you will have to manage AFK's yourself with a custom implementation.
        Returns:
        AFK handler stopped or not

      • enableAFKHandler

        boolean enableAFKHandler()
        Enables the internal AFK handler again if you disabled it.
        Returns:
        AFK handler enabled or not

      • postponeBreaks

        void postponeBreaks()
        Postpones the scheduled breaks for the current emulator.

        This method sets a flag to prevent breaks from occurring while the current script is performing important actions. Once postponed, breaks will remain on hold until resumeBreaks() is called.

      • resumeBreaks

        void resumeBreaks()
        Resumes the ability for breaks to occur for the current emulator.

        This method clears the flag set by postponeBreaks() and allows the break handler to proceed with scheduling or starting breaks as normal.

      • startBreak

        void startBreak​(java.lang.Long timeMilis)
        Starts a forced break for the current emulator.

        This method forces a break for the specified duration, using client built-in logout/login handler.

        Parameters:
        timeMilis - The duration of the forced break in milliseconds.

      • isTimeForBreak

        boolean isTimeForBreak()
        Checks if the client is expecting a break to be done
        Returns:
        True if a break is due

      • postponeBreaksAndSleeps

        void postponeBreaksAndSleeps()
        Postpones the scheduled sleeps and breaks for the current emulator.

        This method sets a flag to prevent sleeps and breaks from occurring while the current script is performing important actions. Once postponed, sleeps and breaks will remain on hold until resumeBreaksAndSleeps() is called.

      • resumeBreaksAndSleeps

        void resumeBreaksAndSleeps()
        Resumes the ability for sleeps and breaks to occur for the current emulator.

        This method clears the flag set by postponeBreaksAndSleeps() and allows the sleep and breaks handler to proceed with scheduling or starting sleeps and breaks as normal.

      • postponeSleeps

        void postponeSleeps()
        Postpones the scheduled sleeps for the current emulator.

        This method sets a flag to prevent sleeps from occurring while the current script is performing important actions. Once postponed, sleeps will remain on hold until resumeSleeps() is called.

      • resumeSleeps

        void resumeSleeps()
        Resumes the ability for sleeps to occur for the current emulator.

        This method clears the flag set by postponeSleeps() and allows the sleep handler to proceed with scheduling or starting sleeps as normal.

      • isTimeForSleep

        boolean isTimeForSleep()
        Checks if the client is expecting a sleep to be done
        Returns:
        True if a break is due

      • isColorInRect

        boolean isColorInRect​(java.awt.Color targetColor,
                      java.awt.Rectangle regionToSearch,
                      int tolerance)
        Checks if a specified color is found within a rectangle area on the game screen
        Parameters:
        targetColor - the color to look for.
        regionToSearch - The area on the screen you'd like to search in
        tolerance - the color tolerance for matching the target color.
        Returns:
        true/false if found or not

      • isAnyColorInRect

        boolean isAnyColorInRect​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> targetColors,
                         java.awt.Rectangle regionToSearch,
                         int tolerance)
        Checks if specified colors is found within a rectangle area on the game screen
        Parameters:
        targetColors - the colors to look for.
        regionToSearch - The area on the screen you'd like to search in
        tolerance - the color tolerance for matching the target color.
        Returns:
        true/false if found or not

      • isColorAtPoint

        boolean isColorAtPoint​(java.awt.Color targetColor,
                       java.awt.Point pointToSearch,
                       int tolerance)
        Checks if a specified color is found on a specific point on the game screen
        Parameters:
        targetColor - the color to look for.
        pointToSearch - The point on the screen you'd like to search in
        tolerance - the color tolerance for matching the target color.
        Returns:
        true/false if found or not

      • getObjectsFromColor

        java.util.List<java.awt.Rectangle> getObjectsFromColor​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                                                       int tolerance)
        Retrieves a list of rectangles containing objects of specified colors with the given tolerance level.
        Parameters:
        colors - The list of colors to search for.
        tolerance - The tolerance level for color matching.
        Returns:
        A list of rectangles containing objects of the specified colors.

      • getObjectsFromColor

        java.util.List<java.awt.Rectangle> getObjectsFromColor​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                                                       int tolerance,
                                                       java.util.List<java.awt.Color> exclusionColors,
                                                       int exclusionTolerance)
        Retrieves a list of rectangles containing objects of specified colors with the given tolerance level, excluding objects of specified exclusion colors with the given exclusion tolerance.
        Parameters:
        colors - The list of colors to search for.
        tolerance - The tolerance level for color matching.
        exclusionColors - The list of colors to exclude from the search.
        exclusionTolerance - The tolerance level for excluding colors.
        Returns:
        A list of rectangles containing objects of the specified colors, excluding those of the specified exclusion colors.

      • getObjectsFromColorsInRect

        java.util.List<java.awt.Rectangle> getObjectsFromColorsInRect​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                                                              java.awt.Rectangle searchRect,
                                                              int tolerance)
        Retrieves a list of rectangles containing objects of specified colors within the given search rectangle.
        Parameters:
        colors - The list of colors to search for.
        searchRect - The rectangle within which to search for the colors.
        tolerance - The tolerance level for color matching.
        Returns:
        A list of rectangles containing objects of the specified colors.

      • getObjectsFromColorsInRect

        java.util.List<java.awt.Rectangle> getObjectsFromColorsInRect​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                                                              java.awt.Rectangle searchRect,
                                                              int tolerance,
                                                              java.util.List<java.awt.Color> exclusionColors,
                                                              int exclusionTolerance)
        Retrieves a list of rectangles containing objects of specified colors within the given search rectangle, excluding objects of specified exclusion colors.

        searchRect - The rectangle within which to search for the colors.
        tolerance - The tolerance level for color matching.
        exclusionColors - The list of colors to exclude from the search.
        exclusionTolerance - The tolerance level for excluding colors.
        Returns:
        A list of rectangles containing objects of the specified colors, excluding those of the specified exclusion colors.

      • getPointsFromColors

        java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPointsFromColors​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                                                   int tolerance)
        Retrieves points on the current emulator screen where specified colors are found, considering a specified tolerance for color matching. This method acts as a convenience wrapper by fetching the current emulator ID and delegating the color search.
        Parameters:
        colors - A list of Color objects representing the colors to search for.
        tolerance - An int value representing the tolerance used for matching the colors. The higher the tolerance, the more variations of the color will be accepted.
        Returns:
        A List of Point objects, each point representing the location on the screen where one of the specified colors was detected.

      • getPointsFromColors

        java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPointsFromColors​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                                                   int tolerance,
                                                   java.util.List<java.awt.Color> exclusionColors,
                                                   int exclusionTolerance)
        Retrieves points on the current emulator screen where specified colors are found, excluding specified colors within a certain tolerance, and considering a specified tolerance for the target colors. This method provides an enhanced search by excluding unwanted colors and is a convenience wrapper that fetches the current emulator ID and delegates the color search.
        Parameters:
        colors - A list of Color objects representing the colors to search for.
        tolerance - An int value representing the tolerance used for matching the target colors. The higher the tolerance, the more variations of the color will be accepted.
        exclusionColors - A list of Color objects representing the colors to be excluded from the search.
        exclusionTolerance - An int value representing the tolerance used to exclude the unwanted colors. Similar to 'tolerance', the higher this value, the more variations of the exclusion colors will be ignored.
        Returns:
        A List of Point objects, each point representing the location on the screen where one of the specified target colors was detected, excluding any matches found within the exclusion tolerance for the colors specified in 'exclusionColors'.

      • getPointsFromColorsInRect

        java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPointsFromColorsInRect​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                                                         java.awt.Rectangle searchRect,
                                                         int tolerance)
        Searches for specified colors within a defined rectangular area of the game screen, taking into account a specified color tolerance for matching. This method will return a list of points where the colors were found.
        Parameters:
        colors - A list of Color objects representing the colors to search for.
        searchRect - A Rectangle defining the area within which to search for the colors.
        tolerance - An int value representing the tolerance used to match the colors. The higher the tolerance, the more variations of the color will be accepted.
        Returns:
        A List of Point objects, each representing a pixel location where one of the specified colors was detected.

      • getPointsFromColorsInRect

        java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPointsFromColorsInRect​(java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
                                                         java.awt.Rectangle searchRect,
                                                         int tolerance,
                                                         java.util.List<java.awt.Color> exclusionColors,
                                                         int exclusionTolerance)
        Searches for specified colors within a defined rectangular area of the game screen, excluding specified colors within a certain tolerance, and taking into account a specified color tolerance for the target colors. This method returns a list of points where the target colors were found, excluding the specified unwanted colors.
        Parameters:
        colors - A list of Color objects representing the colors to search for.
        searchRect - A Rectangle defining the area within which to search for the colors.
        tolerance - An int value representing the tolerance used to match the target colors. The higher the tolerance, the more variations of the color will be accepted.
        exclusionColors - A list of Color objects representing the colors to be excluded from the search.
        exclusionTolerance - An int value representing the tolerance used to exclude the unwanted colors. Similar to 'tolerance', the higher this value, the more variations of the exclusion colors will be ignored.
        Returns:
        A List of Point objects, each representing a pixel location where one of the specified target colors was detected, excluding any matches found within the exclusion tolerance for the colors specified in 'exclusionColors'.
